thread.title: Andrew Johns joins NRL stars in San Francisco to watch Jarryd Hayne play for 49ers

title: Andrew Johns joins NRL stars in San Francisco to watch Jarryd Hayne play for 49ers
text:

An evening to forget for Hayne Jarryd Hayne fumbles in one of two touches for the 49ers. San Francisco snapped a four game losing streak with a 5-point win over Baltimore.
PT1M25S 620 349 Quiet day for Hayne in 49ers' win As it happened: 49ers v Ravens Andrew Johns has joined a host of NRL players and Jarryd Hayne's closest friends at the San Francisco 49ers game at Levi's Stadium on Monday morning.
Hayne's friends have been in the United States visiting the former rugby league superstar for the past week, joined recently by Canterbury forward Tony Williams and ex-NRL star Willie Tonga for the 49ers' home game against the Baltimore Ravens.
Hayne gang: Krisnan Inu with Andrew Johns and friends at the the San Francisco 49ers versus Baltimore Ravens match on Monday.
Hayne's former teammates Krisnan Inu, Feleti Mateo, Esi Tonga and Joseph and Junior Paulo - as well as Parramatta Eels chaplain George Dansey - were among a large group of friends who were joined by Johns at Hayne's sixth game of his NFL career.
Advertisement Hayne organised for the rugby league immortal to sit alongside his friends, who earlier in the week mingled with Australian NBA star Andrew Bogut after a Golden State Warriors preseason game at Oracle Arena.
"I had the time of my life," Inu said.
"Bigger than the NRL grand final, and to experience it with all the brothers including Feleti Mateo, Tony Williams, the Paulo and Tonga brothers, made the experience that much more better."
While Hayne didn't see much time against the Ravens, Paulo described the 25-20 victory for the 49ers as "the best experience I have been to".
Johns, who was stood down by Channel Nine from the NRL grand final broadcast after an incident at Toowoomba airport , has been holidaying in the US since the day after the NRL decider.
One of Hayne's close friends Robert Mykietyn said having the league Immortal alongside Hayne's crew made the occasion even more special.
"Travelling across the world with our close friends and having Andrew Johns to cheer our boy chase his dreams has been an unforgettable experience."
Another of his friends, Daniel Petras, described it as "the experience of a lifetime".
